CMSE180.name: Introduction to Data Science
CMSE180.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
CMSE180.description: Pervasiveness and utility of data in modern society. Obtaining and managing data. Summarizing and visualizing data. Ethical issues in data science. Communication with data. Fundamentals of probability and statistics.
CMSE180.prerequisite: (MTH 124 or concurrently) or (MTH 132 or concurrently) or (MTH 152H or concurrently) or (LB 118 or concurrently)

CMSE201.name: Introduction to Computational Modeling and Data Analysis
CMSE201.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
CMSE201.description: Computational modeling using a wide variety of applications examples. Algorithmic thinking, dataset manipulation, model building, data visualization, and numerical methods all implemented as programs.
CMSE201.prerequisite: MTH 124 or MTH 132 or MTH 152H or LB 118

CMSE202.name: Computational Modeling Tools and Techniques
CMSE202.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
CMSE202.description: Continuation of introduction to computational modeling focusing on standard methods and tools used for modeling and data analysis. Topics may include statistical analysis, symbolic math, linear algebra, simulation techniques, data mining.

CMSE314.name: Matrix Algebra with Computational Applications
CMSE314.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
CMSE314.description: Numerical methods in linear algebra with applications to systems of equations and eigenvalue problems, and geometry.
CMSE314.prerequisite: (MTH 133 or MTH 153H or LB 119) and (CMSE 201 or CSE 231)
CMSE314.restrictions: Not open to students in the Actuarial Science Major or in the Bachelor of Arts in Computational Mathematics or in the Bachelor of Science in Computational Mathematics or in the Bachelor of Science in Mathematics or in the Bachelor of Arts in Mathematics or in the Bachelor of Science in Mathematics, Advanced or in the Bachelor of Arts in Mathematics, Advanced or in the Mathematics Minor or in the Mathematics-Elementary Disciplinary Teaching Minor or in Mathematics-Secondary Disciplinary Teaching Minor.

CMSE381.name: Fundamentals of Data Science Methods
CMSE381.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
CMSE381.description: Data science methods, including unsupervised learning and supervised learning, feature extraction, dimension reduction, clustering, regression and classification.
CMSE381.prerequisite: (STT 180 and MTH 314 and CMSE 201 and STT 380) or (STT 180 and MTH 314 and CMSE 201 and STT 441 and STT 442)

CMSE382.name: Optimization Methods in Data Science
CMSE382.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
CMSE382.description: Concepts, mathematical foundations, methods, and algorithms of optimization in data modeling, all applied to modeling real-world data.

CMSE401.name: Methods for Parallel Computing
CMSE401.description: Core principles, techniques, and use of parallel computation using modern supercomputers. Parallel architectures and programming models. Message-passing and threaded programming. Principles of parallel algorithm design. Performance analysis and optimization.
CMSE401.prerequisite: (CMSE 202 and CSE 232) and (MTH 235 or MTH 340 or MTH 347H)

CMSE402.name: Data Visualization Principles and Techniques
CMSE402.description: Core principles, methods, and techniques of effective data visualization. Visualization toolkits. Vector and scalar data. Multivariate visualization. Relationship between data analysis and visualization.

CMSE404.name: Introduction to Machine Learning
CMSE404.description: Core principles and techniques of all machine learning including model design and programming algorithms.
CMSE404.prerequisite: (CSE 331) and (STT 351 or STT 380 or STT 430 or STT 441)
CMSE404.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors in the College of Engineering or in the Computer Science Minor or in the Lyman Briggs Computer Science Coordinate Major or in the Lyman Briggs Computer Science Major.

CMSE410.name: Bioinformatics and Computational Biology
CMSE410.description: Computational approaches in modern biology with a focus on applications in genomics, systems biology, evolution, and structural biology.
CMSE410.prerequisite: {(CMSE 201 and LB 144 and LB 145) or (CMSE 201 and BS 161 and BS 162) or (CMSE 201 and BS 181H and BS 182H)} and (STT 200 or STT 201 or STT 231 or STT 421 or STT 351 or ECE 280)

CMSE411.name: Computational Medicine
CMSE411.description: Computational approaches in biology with a focus on medicine.
CMSE411.prerequisite: (CMSE 201 and LB 144 and LB 145) or (CMSE 201 and BS 161 and BS 162) or (CMSE 201 and BS 181H and BS 182H)

CMSE491.name: Selected Topics in Computational Mathematics, Science, and Engineering
CMSE491.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
CMSE491.description: Topics selected to supplement and enrich existing courses and lead to the development of new courses.

CMSE492.name: Selected Topics in Data Science
CMSE492.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
CMSE492.description: Topics selected to supplement and enrich existing courses in Data Science.

CMSE495.name: Experiential Learning in Data Science (W)
CMSE495.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
CMSE495.description: Team-based data science projects on realistic, large-scale data.
CMSE495.prerequisite: (CSE 232 and CMSE 382) and completion of Tier I writing requirement

CMSE499.name: Independent Study in Computational Mathematics, Science, and Engineering
CMSE499.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
CMSE499.description: Supervised individual research or study in an area of computational or data science.

CMSE801.name: Introduction to Computational Modeling and Data Analysis
CMSE801.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
CMSE801.description: Introduction to computational modeling using a wide variety of application examples. Algorithmic thinking and model building, data visualization, numerical methods, all implemented as programs. Command line interfaces. Scientific software development techniques including modular programming, testing, and version control.

CMSE802.name: Methods in Computational Modeling
CMSE802.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
CMSE802.description: Standard computational modeling methods and tools. Programming and code-management techniques.

CMSE820.name: Mathematical Foundations of Data Science
CMSE820.description: Fundamental mathematical principles of data science that underlie the algorithms, processes, and methods of data-centric thinking, and tools based on these principles.

CMSE821.name: Numerical Methods for Differential Equations
CMSE821.description: Numerical solution of ordinary and partial differential equations, including hyperbolic, parabolic, and elliptic equations. Explicit and implicit solutions. Numerical stability.

CMSE822.name: Parallel Computing
CMSE822.description: Core principles, techniques, and use of parallel computation using modern supercomputers. Parallel architectures. Parallel programming models. Principles of parallel algorithm design. Performance analysis and optimization.

CMSE823.name: Numerical Linear Algebra
CMSE823.description: Methods in modern numerical linear algebra for solving linear systems, least squares problems, and eigenvalue problems. Efficiency and stability of algorithms in numerical linear algebra.

CMSE830.name: Foundations of Data Science (Interim New)
CMSE830.description: Core mathematical principles that underlie the algorithms and methods used in data science. Applications to problems in data analysis.
CMSE830.restrictions: Not open to doctoral students in the Computational Mathematics, Science and Engineering.

CMSE831.name: Computational Optimization (Interim New)
CMSE831.description: Applications and algorithms for finite-dimensional linear and non-linear optimization problems.

CMSE890.name: Selected Topics in Computational Mathematics, Science, and Engineering
CMSE890.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
CMSE890.description: Topics selected to supplement and enrich existing courses.

CMSE891.name: Independent Study in Computational Mathematics, Science, and Engineering
CMSE891.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
CMSE891.description: Topics selected to supplement and enrich existing courses.

CMSE899.name: Master's Thesis Research
CMSE899.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
CMSE899.restrictions: Open to master's students in the Department of Computational Mathematics, Science, and Engineering.

CMSE999.name: Doctoral Dissertation Research
CMSE999.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
CMSE999.restrictions: Open to doctoral students in the Department of Computational Mathematics, Science, and Engineering.
